verses.roman:
pralambo dhenuko 'riṣṭas
tṛṇāvarto bakādayaḥ
daityāḥ surāsura-jito
hatā yeneha līlayā

synonyms: pralambaḥ dhenukaḥ ariṣṭaḥ—Pralamba, Dhenuka and Ariṣṭa; tṛṇāvartaḥ—Tṛṇāvarta; baka-ādayaḥ—Baka and others; daityāḥ—demons; sura-asura—both the demigods and the demons; jitaḥ—who conquered; hatāḥ—killed; yena—by whom; iha—here (in Vṛndāvana); līlayā—easily.
translation: Here in Vṛndāvana, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma easily destroyed demons like Pralamba, Dhenuka, Arista, Tṛṇāvarta and Baka, who had themselves defeated both demigods and other demons.
